thread.title: Dundee upends Midlakes 38-26; finale at home puts Scotsmen in sectional tournament
thread.title_full: Dundee upends Midlakes 38-26; finale at home puts Scotsmen in sectional tournament

author: Gary Pinneo
title: Dundee upends Midlakes 38-26; finale at home puts Scotsmen in sectional tournament
text: Posted Oct. 17, 2015 at 7:42 PM By Gary Pinneo Posted Oct. 17, 2015 at 7:42 PM Dundee A trip to the Section V Class D tournament was on the line for the Dundee Scots as they prepared for Saturday's regular season finale against Midlakes. Dundee needed a win to qualify for the tournament. Midlakes was short handed going into the game, but still a determined and tough foe to beat. But the hometown Scots were up to the task on a brisk, November-like day at Scotsmen Field. Dundee defeated Midlakes 38-26 and will advance to play another day. The Scots scored on their 2nd possession of the day. Senior Quarterback Austin Thompson scored on a 11-yard run and Dundee was off and running. The Maroon and White led the game 6-0 with the game barely 4 minutes old. They guarded this lead as the first quarter came to a close. Dundee went to the air in the second quarter. Devin Jensen grabbed a 10-yard scoring pass from Thompson, and the Scots extended their lead to 12-0. This was Jensen's 4th touchdown catch of the season and 8th thrown by Austin Thompson. But the Screaming Eagles came to life on their next possession and scored to cut the Dundee lead to 12-6. The continued their momentum with another touchdown set up by a fake punt and suddenly the game was tied at 12 with the first half drawing to a close. Midlakes continued to pour it on in the third quarter. They scored a touchdown on their first possession of the second half and suddenly the stubborn Eagles were leading the game 18-12. The Scotsmen regained their composure and pushed in a touchdown late in the third quarter. Devin Jensen kicked the extra point and the hometown Scots regained the lead 19-18 with 3 quarters of the game finished. The 4th quarter began with Dundee stepping up with a big sack and a forced fumble. Johvannie Andrades galloped 57 yards to score Dundee's 4th touchdown. Andrades enjoyed a big day rushing, collecting 160 yards for Dundee. The Scots expanded their lead to 25-18. Austin Thompson scored his 3rd TD of the game a few minutes later and Dundee grabbed a commanding 38-18 lead with just 3 minutes remaining. Midlakes scored late in the game but it was much too little. Dundee won the game they needed to win, 38-26. Up next for the Scots, a Sectional game next weekend â€” game that will be a rematch against either Red Jacket or Clyde-Savannah. Dundee ends their regular season schedule with a 4-3 record. They have put together a 3 game winning streak. By Gary Pinneo
